Title:
Evolution of long-distance seed dispersal and population
extinction: why fire-killed nonsprouters disperse further than
fire-persistent resprouters
Abstract:
Long-distance seed dispersal (LDD) beyond local
populations has fundamental importance for ecology and evolution. It is,
however, unclear to what extent natural selection shapes LDD. In a
phylogenetic comparative study, we test whether species facing frequent
catastrophic population extinction have increased LDD.
